docs.text:
• hello completion - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell
  • hello docs -

docs.title: hello completion
docs.text: Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text: Generate the autocompletion script for hello for the specified shell. See each sub-command's help for details on how to use the generated script.

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text:
• hello -
  • hello completion bash - Generate the autocompletion script for bash
  • hello completion fish - Generate the autocompletion script for fish
  • hello completion powershell - Generate the autocompletion script for powershell
  • hello completion zsh - Generate the autocompletion script for zsh

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Generate the autocompletion script for the bash shell.

This script depends on the 'bash-completion' package. If it is not installed already, you can install it via your OS's package manager.

To load completions in your current shell session:

source <(hello completion bash)

To load completions for every new session, execute once:

docs.title: macOS:
docs.text:
hello completion bash > $(brew --prefix)/etc/bash_completion.d/hello

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.

hello completion bash

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help              help for bash
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • hello completion - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Generate the autocompletion script for the fish shell.

To load completions in your current shell session:

hello completion fish | source

To load completions for every new session, execute once:

hello completion fish > ~/.config/fish/completions/hello.fish

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.

hello completion fish [flags]

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help              help for fish
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • hello completion - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Generate the autocompletion script for powershell.

To load completions in your current shell session:

hello completion powershell | Out-String | Invoke-Expression

To load completions for every new session, add the output of the above command to your powershell profile.

hello completion powershell [flags]

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help              help for powershell
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • hello completion - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Generate the autocompletion script for the zsh shell.

If shell completion is not already enabled in your environment you will need to enable it. You can execute the following once:

echo "autoload -U compinit; compinit" >> ~/.zshrc

To load completions in your current shell session:

source <(hello completion zsh); compdef _hello hello

To load completions for every new session, execute once:

docs.title: macOS:
docs.text:
hello completion zsh > $(brew --prefix)/share/zsh/site-functions/_hello

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.

hello completion zsh [flags]

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help              help for zsh
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • hello completion - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell

docs.title: SEE ALSO

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text:
• pkg -
  • pkg install appimage-launcher - https://github.com/TheAssassin/AppImageLauncher/wiki/Install-on-Ubuntu-or-Debian
  • pkg install brew - https://brew.sh/
  • pkg install cfw - https://github.com/Fndroid/clash_for_windows_pkg/releases/
  • pkg install cloudflare-warp - https://pkg.cloudflareclient.com/install
  • pkg install code - https://code.visualstudio.com
  • pkg install conda - https://conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/install/macos.html
  • pkg install edge - https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/edge/download
  • pkg install grub-theme - https://github.com/vinceliuice/grub2-themes
  • pkg install typora - https://typora.io
  • pkg install zotero - https://www.zotero.org/download/

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-b, --batch           run install in batch mode (without manual intervention), it is expected the license terms (if any) are agreed upon
  -f, --force           no error if install prefix already exists
  -h, --help            help for conda
  -p, --prefix string   install prefix, must not contain spaces. (default "/home/runner/.local/opt/conda")
  -s, --skip            skip running pre/post-link/install scripts
  -t, --tests           run package tests after installation (may install conda-build)
  -u, --update          update an existing installation
